hook.text: How you see yourself in photos shapes how you see yourself in life. Photography constructs identity.

buildup.text: Before cameras, most people had no accurate image of themselves. Mirrors were rare. Photography changed self-perception.

discovery.text: Social media profiles are curated self-portraits. We select, filter, and present an ideal version of ourselves.

twist.text: The gap between the curated self and the real self creates anxiety. People feel they can't match their own photos.

climax.text: Photography's power over identity is double-edged. It can empower self-expression or impose impossible standards.

punchline.text: The photo shows who you want to be. The mirror shows who you are.

quiz.question: How has photography affected self-identity in the social media era?
options: Curated profiles create a gap between the ideal self and reality causing anxiety
It has no effect on identity
